Attachments.Name: Minutes of the Stated Meeting - June 16, 2022
Pay Equity in NYC Report - September 2022

Summary: This bill would amend the existing Pay Equity Law, Local Law 18/2019, by requiring the Department of Citywide Administrative Services to collect and provide additional employment data to the Council, through the Office of Data Analytics, for the purpose of identifying pay disparity in the municipal workforce. This bill would eliminate time limitations on the Council’s access to such data.

\pard\ltrpar\fi720\sl480\slmult1\qj\cf1 Section 1. Subchapter 7 of chapter 1 of title 3 of the administrative code of the city of New York, as added by local law number 18 for the year 2019, is amended to read as follows:\par
\pard\ltrpar\sl480\slmult1\qc SUBCHAPTER 7\par
OFFICE OF DATA ANALYTICS\par
\pard\ltrpar\fi720\sl480\slmult1\qj\'a7 3-170 General. a. \ul Definitions.\ulnone  As used in this subchapter, the following terms have the following meanings:\par
Agency. The term \ldblquote agency\rdblquote  means any agency, \ul office, department, division, or bureau,\ulnone  the head of which holds office upon appointment of the mayor and those units within the executive office of the mayor designated by the mayor to be covered by the provisions of chapter 16 of the charter\cf0 .\cf1  Such term does not include agencies headed by boards, commissions, or other multi-member bodies, whether appointed by the mayor or otherwise, nor to elected officials\cf0 , \cf1 nor to other agencies the heads of which are appointed by officials other than the mayor or by multi-member bodies.\cf0\fs22\par
\cf1\fs24 Director. The term \ldblquote director\rdblquote  means the director of the office of data analytics.\cf0\fs22\par
\cf1\fs24 Machine-readable format.\b  \b0 The term \ldblquote machine-readable format\rdblquote  means a non-proprietary format that permits automated processing.\cf0\fs22\par
\cf1\fs24 Office. The term \ldblquote office\rdblquote  means the office of data analytics.\cf0\fs22\par
\cf1\ul\fs24 Censored data. The term \ldblquote censored data\rdblquote  means any data which is subject to redaction or withholding due to concerns that it may reveal personally identifying information, or any other legal concerns that may prohibit its distribution.\cf0\ulnone\fs22\par
\cf1\ul\fs24 Sanitized data. The term \ldblquote sanitized data\rdblquote  means any data generated with or without the use of censored data that does not reveal personally identifying information and is not legally prohibited from publication for any other reason.\cf0\ulnone\fs22\par
\cf1\fs24 Open source analytics library. The term \ldblquote open source analytics library\rdblquote  means the website\ul , and any other platform,\ulnone  where the source code for data analytics projects are shared and maintained by the mayor\rquote s office of data analytics.\cf0\fs22\par
\cf1\fs24 b. All agencies shall cooperate with the office as may be necessary and proper to ensure compliance with this subchapter. The office may request information from any agency it deems necessary to enable it to properly carry out its functions.\cf0\fs22\par
\cf1\fs24 c. The director may promulgate such rules as are necessary to carry out the provisions of this subchapter.\cf0\fs22\par
\cf1\fs24\'a7 3-171 Pay and employment equity data. a. Within 60 days following\cf0  \ul the annual\cf1\ulnone  receipt of the data from the department of citywide administrative services pursuant to section 12-208, the office, in consultation with the department of information technology and telecommunications, shall \ul permanently\ulnone  make such data available to the council [for 90 days] through an application programming interface (API) in a machine-readable format as either comma separated value (CSV) or JavaScript Object Notation (json) for which the office shall provide a key to the council; \ul or a secure virtual machine interface to which authorized users, designated by the council, will be provided access\ulnone .\fs22\par
\ul\fs24 b. 1. The office, in consultation with the department of information technology and telecommunications, shall: \highlight2\fs22\par
\highlight0\fs24 (a) Provide data requested by the council and make such data available to the council in a machine-readable format within 7 business days of such request;\cf0\ulnone\fs22\par
\cf1\ul\fs24 (b) Provide an account with access to such data for each individual identified by the council; \par
(c) Enable data sharing capabilities between all access accounts provided to the council;\cf0\ulnone\fs22\par
\cf1\ul\fs24 (d) Deliver any external data prepared by the council to all of the accounts requested by the council in the format that such data was prepared in, within 7 business days of such request; and\cf0\ulnone\fs22\par
\cf1\ul\fs24 (e) Install software requested by the council within 7 business days of such request, provided that, if the office determines, in consultation with the department of information technology and telecommunications, that such software presents a security risk, the office shall notify the council and identify in writing the details of such risk and propose alternative software within 7 business days. \fs22\par
\fs24 2. If data is not provided or delivered pursuant to subparagraphs (a) or (d) within 7 business days, the office shall provide a detailed explanation to the council and a timeframe when such data will be provided or delivered, as applicable.\fs22\par
\fs24 3. Code written and stored by the council shall be saved for 7 years for retrieval and usage by the council in its discretion.\cf0\ulnone\fs22\par
\cf1\fs24 [b.] \ul c.\ulnone  1. The office shall issue a report to the mayor and speaker of the council no later than May 31, 2020, and no later than May 31 annually thereafter, and shall post such report on the open source analytics library. Such report shall include aggregated data from each agency showing the frequency of full-time, part-time and seasonal employees by agency, EEO-4 job group, pay band, racial group, ethnicity and gender in a format that prevents the disclosure of the racial group, ethnicity and gender of any employee, while maximizing the level of detail at which such data is reported.\cf0\fs22\par
\cf1\fs24 2. Pay bands for such report as required by paragraph 1 of this subdivision shall be for $2,500, $5,000 and $10,000; however, the department of citywide administrative services, in conjunction with the office, may determine by rule other appropriate pay bands, if any, that will maximize the level of detail at which data is reported.\cf0\fs22\par
\cf1\fs24 [c.] \ul d.\ulnone  Ninety days after the second annual report is issued pursuant to subdivision [b] \ul c\ulnone  of this section, the office, in conjunction with the department of citywide administrative services, shall conduct an annual analysis of the data collected pursuant to section 12-208, including comparisons with data from previous years, in order to identify potential disparities based on gender, race or other protected classes as identified in section 8-101, in the following areas:\cf0\fs22\par
\cf1\fs24 1. Pay;\cf0\fs22\par
\cf1\fs24 2. Employment rates; and\cf0\fs22\par
\cf1\fs24 3. Retention rates.\cf0\fs22\par
\cf1\fs24 [d.] \ul e.\ulnone  The office shall conduct further analysis with relevant agencies where instances of disparities exist. Such analysis shall be included in the annual report as required pursuant to subdivision [b] \ul c\ulnone  of this section.\cf0\fs22\par
\cf1\fs24 [e.] \ul f.\ulnone  The department of citywide administrative services shall be required to make recommendations on the development and implementation of pay, employment\ul ,\ulnone  and retention equity action plans to the mayor and speaker of the council based on disparities identified in subdivision [d] \ul e\ulnone  of this section. Such recommendations shall be included in the annual report as required pursuant to subdivision [b] \ul c\ulnone  of this section.\cf0\fs22\par
\cf1\fs24\'a7 2. Section 12-208 of the administrative code of the city of New York, as added by local law number 18 for the year 2019, is amended to read as follows:\cf0\par
\cf1\'a7 12-208 Pay and employment equity data. a. Definitions. As used in this section, the term \ldblquote agency\rdblquote  means any agency, \ul office, department, division, or bureau,\ulnone  the head of which holds office upon appointment of the mayor and those units within the executive office of the mayor designated by the mayor to be covered by the provisions of chapter 16 of the charter. Such term does not include agencies headed by boards, commissions, or other multi-member bodies, whether appointed by the mayor or otherwise, nor to elected officials, nor to other agencies the heads of which are appointed by officials other than the mayor or by multi-member bodies.\cf0\par
\cf1 b. No later than November 30, 2019, and on or before November 30 annually thereafter, each agency\cf0 , \cf1 to the extent the department of citywide administrative services does not already have such information, shall provide to the department of citywide administrative services information relevant to pay and employment equity. Such information for each current and former employee within such agency\ul , \ulnone shall be as of the date of hire and shall, to the extent such information is available, include[:] \ul the data set forth in paragraphs 1 through 30 of this subdivision. Such data shall include a unique identifier for each employee, other than with respect to employee benefits. \cf0 Each such identifier shall be \cf1 identical for each such employee across all data sets starting with the first data set provided to the council in 2024.\par
\ulnone 1. Agency;\cf0\fs22\par
\cf1\fs24 2. Start date;\cf0\fs22\par
\cf1\fs24 3. \ul Start date in current civil service title;\highlight2\fs22\par
\highlight0\fs24 4.\ulnone  Civil service title;\cf0\fs22\par
\cf1\ul\fs24 5. Whether the civil service title is a promotional title;\highlight2\fs22\par
\highlight0\fs24 6. Union status per civil service title, including, where applicable, name of the union and job or title category of the bargaining unit; \highlight2\fs22\par
\highlight0\fs24 7. Whether the civil service title is a uniformed position;\fs22\par
\ulnone\fs24 [4.] \ul 8.\ulnone  Salary range for such title;\cf0\fs22\par
\cf1\fs24 [5.] \ul 9.\ulnone  Business title;\cf0\fs22\par
\cf1\fs24 [6.] \ul 10.\ulnone  Title classification (title description);\cf0\fs22\par
\cf1\fs24 [7.] \ul 11.\ulnone  Job category;\cf0\fs22\par
\cf1\fs24 [8.] \ul 12.\ulnone  Career level;\cf0\fs22\par
\cf1\fs24 [9.] \ul 13.\ulnone  Base salary;\cf0\fs22\par
\cf1\fs24 [10.] \ul 14.\ulnone  The department of citywide administrative services occupational group code and group name;\cf0\fs22\par
\cf1\fs24 [11.] \ul 15.\ulnone  Whether such employee is a managerial or supervisory employee;\cf0\fs22\par
\cf1\fs24 [12.] \ul 16.\ulnone  Minimum number of years of work experience required for such position;\cf0\fs22\par
\cf1\fs24 [13.] \ul 17.\ulnone  Number of years of work experience of such employee;\cf0\fs22\par
\cf1\fs24 [14.] \ul 18.\ulnone  Highest level of education attained by such employee;\cf0\fs22\par
\cf1\fs24 [15.] \ul 19.\ulnone  Gender;\cf0\fs22\par
\cf1\fs24 [16.] \ul 20.\ulnone  Racial group;\cf0\fs22\par
\cf1\fs24 [17.] \ul 21.\ulnone  Ethnicity;\cf0\fs22\par
\cf1\fs24 [18.] \ul 22.\ulnone  Date of birth;\cf0\fs22\par
\cf1\fs24 [19.] \ul 23.\ulnone  Whether such employee is a provisional employee;\cf0\fs22\par
\cf1\fs24 [20.] \ul 24.\ulnone  Whether such employee is full-time, part-time or seasonal;\cf0\fs22\par
\cf1\fs24 [21.] \ul 25.\ulnone  Change in personnel status, including but not limited to, appointed, deceased, decrease, demoted, dismissed, increase, promoted, resigned, retired, terminated and transfer; [and;]\cf0\fs22\par
\cf1\fs24 [22.] \ul 26.\ulnone  Whether such employee was previously employed by the city of New York [.] \ul ;\cf0\ulnone\fs22\par
\cf1\ul\fs24 27. Total amount of leave taken; \highlight2\fs22\par
\highlight0\fs24 28. Total amount of overtime pay per employee, where applicable;\highlight2\fs22\par
\highlight0\fs24 29. Estimated amount of annual employee benefits paid per civil service titles; and\f1  \f0\par
30. All data sets made available in all prior years pursuant to this section, except that the unique identifier requireed by subdivision b shall only be required for data sets provided for 2024 and thereafter.\par
\ulnone c. The data collected pursuant to subdivision b shall include pedagogues of the department of education. Such data may be provided in the format in which it is retained by the department of education. \par
d. No later than 90 days following receipt of the data collected pursuant to subdivision b of this section, the department of citywide administrative services shall provide such data to the office of data analytics.\par
e. All agencies shall cooperate with the department as may be necessary and proper to ensure compliance with this subdivision. The department may request from any agency, including the office of payroll administration and financial information services agency, information it deems necessary to enable it to properly carry out its functions.\par
\'a7 3. This local law takes effect immediately. \par
